title: pH of pure water at 55 C

content.description: <math alttext="H 2 O liquid plus H 2 O liquid is in equilibrium with H 3 O with a positive charge aqueous plus O H with a negative charge aqueous. K sub w equals 7.0 times 10 to the negative 14 power at 55 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⇄</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>) </mtext><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>w</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>7.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>14</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> </mtext><mtext>at </mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>55</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Pure water autoionizes as shown in the equation above. Based on this information, which of the following is correct?

choices.label: The autoionization equilibrium for pure water favors the formation of reactants more at <math alttext="55 degrees Celsius " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>55</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> than at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The autoionization equilibrium for pure water produces the same amount of <math alttext="O H with a negative 1 charge " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions at <math alttext="55 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>55</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

At <math alttext="55 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>55</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="p H equals the negative log of the square root of K sub w" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH =</mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mo>−</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>log</mi><mtext>(</mtext><mo>⁢</mo><msqrt><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>w</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for pure water.

At <math alttext="55 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>55</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="p H equals the negative log of K sub w" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>log</mi><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>w</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for pure water.

content.answer: At <math alttext="55 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>55</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="p H equals the negative log of the square root of K sub w" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH =</mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mo>−</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>log</mi><mtext>(</mtext><mo>⁢</mo><msqrt><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>w</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for pure water.

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
